Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Initial commit: Phase 1 & 2 - WhyGO Management System

Phase 1: Data Import & Parser
- Built markdown to JSON parser for WhyGO documents
- Imported 4 company goals, 14 department goals, 2 individual goals
- 74 total outcomes with quarterly targets
- Employee and department reference data

Phase 2: Progress Tracking with Repository Pattern
- Clean architecture with repository pattern \(swappable backends\)
- Progress tracking service with automatic status calculation
- CLI tools for recording progress and viewing dashboards
- Status indicators: [+] on pace, [~] slightly off, [-] off pace

Features:
- Record quarterly actuals with notes and blockers
- View company, department, outcome, and person dashboards
- Automatic status calculation based on actual vs target
- Progress history tracking

Tech Stack:
- Python 3.9+ with dataclasses
- Repository pattern with ABC interfaces
- JSON data storage \(designed for easy DB migration\)
- CLI tools with argparse

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add Phase 3 implementation plan: Slack integration

Added comprehensive Phase 3 plan for Slack bot integration with refined
user flows based on team preferences.

Key features planned:
- Natural language progress updates via Slack DMs
- Automated weekly reminders \(Monday 9am\)
- Leadership dashboard \(Monday 9:30am\)
- Manager escalation workflow
- Role-based dashboards with slash commands

UX decisions documented:
- Absolute value parsing priority \("now at 5" = set to 5\)
- Batch confirmations for multi-update messages
- Neutral & factual tone for off-pace outcomes
- Transparency with named blockers in leadership view
- Baseline outcome handling

Technical approach:
- Reuses existing Phase 2 services \(ProgressService, WhygoService\)
- Slack Bolt framework with socket mode
- Regex-based NL parser with LLM upgrade path
- Scheduled reminders with escalation logic

This plan builds on completed Phases 1 & 2 to drive team adoption.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
